entry.title: Billy Milligan: Man of 24 Faces or Violent Conman

media:group.media:title: Billy Milligan: Man of 24 Faces or Violent Conman
media:group.media:description:
Billy Milligan robbed drugstores, assaulted strangers, and raped four women before robbing them as well. But he would tell you that he didn't have any memories of his crimes - in fact, he didn't do it. Instead, it was a 19-year-old lesbian named Adalana - one of the 24 personalities that lived within him.

media:group.media:title: The Shark Arm Murders
media:group.media:description:
What happens when you catch a shark that swallowed another shark that swallowed a human arm? You get the most bizarre unsolved murder in Australian history. We’ll even throw in a second unsolved murder for free.

entry.title: Lam Kor Wan: The Jars Murderer

media:group.media:title: Lam Kor Wan: The Jars Murderer
media:group.media:description:
This is the story of Chen Feng Lan, Chen Yun Jie, Liang Xiu Yun, and Liang Hui Xin - the four victims of Hong Kong’s first known serial killer. It's about how they'd lost their lives to a monster, and how he was finally brought to justice.

media:group.media:title: Peter Kürten: The Vampire of Düsseldorf
media:group.media:description:
The Vampire of Düsseldorf is perhaps one of the most demented, sadistic, monstrous, depraved, and literally bloodthirsty individuals we’ve ever covered on this show - yes, even worse than Pedro Lopez. So fair warning - here be monsters.

entry.title: The Butcher Baker: Alaska’s Most Dangerous Game

media:group.media:title: The Butcher Baker: Alaska’s Most Dangerous Game
media:group.media:description:
Outside of Alaska, not a lot of people have heard of Robert Hansen, the Butcher Baker. He was a special kind of sick bastard - a pathetic "man-child" who took all his insecurities out on the women he killed. As part of his plea deal, he asked that the details of his crimes should remain a secret - but we're more than happy to bring them to light so that no one will forget about the 21 women he'd brutally killed.

entry.title: Bobby Joe Long: The Classified Ads Rapist

media:group.media:title: Bobby Joe Long: The Classified Ads Rapist
media:group.media:description:
Pennysavers were a free community periodical that advertised cheap items for sale, often with a description like '$30 Dresser for sale OB. Contact Lisa.'. And it was these women who would be targeted by Bobby Joe Long, earning him the name 'The Classified Ads Rapist'. But then he took it a step further, murdering at least 10 women in the Tampa Bay area before a brave 17-year-old girl named Lisa McVey escaped his clutches and assisted the police in bringing an end to Bobby Joe Long.

entry.title: The Haunting Case of Yara G: Science Versus Monsters

media:group.media:title: The Haunting Case of Yara G: Science Versus Monsters
media:group.media:description:
On Friday the 26th of November 2010, at 5.15pm, Yara said goodbye to her family, left home, and walked the short distance to her gym. Five hours later, she would die alone in a field while her whole family was out looking for her. It would be six years before justice was served, but this case is proof of what a justice system is capable of when the police focus on catching a murderer.

entry.title: The Romand Affair: The Slaying of Three Generations

media:group.media:title: The Romand Affair: The Slaying of Three Generations
media:group.media:description:
On the morning of the 9th of January, 1993, firefighters were called to the Romand household in Prévessins-Moens, a quiet French town. The firefighters soon established that only one member out of the family of four had survived, and rushed the unconscious man to the hospital. But when the police went to notify the rest of the family of the tragedy, they soon realized that the nightmare was far worse than they'd first imagined - the entire family had been annihilated. The investigation into the multiple murders would reveal the nest of lies that had led a con-man into murdering his entire family.
